questions.prompt: A resident challenges the proof of service for a pay-or-quit notice. What should you double-check first?
questions.explanation: Documenting certified mail plus a follow-up copy is the safest baseline for New Jersey notices.

choices.label: Confirm certified mail and a regular-mail follow up were sent.

meterImpact.summary: Valid service proof eases the dispute and shows diligence.

choices.label: Print the text messages where the resident acknowledged receipt.

meterImpact.summary: Texts help context but rarely satisfy statutory service requirements.

questions.prompt: Your compliance dashboard flags missing annual security-deposit interest statements. What is the best corrective step?
questions.explanation: Annual statements with interest payouts keep you aligned with NJSA 46:8-19.

choices.label: Send statements with owed interest plus a note on the correction plan.

meterImpact.summary: Proactive payouts resolve statutory exposure and rebuild trust.

choices.label: Hold until the next renewal cycle since everyone will sign anyway.

meterImpact.summary: Deferring keeps you out of compliance and heightens risk of treble damages.
